intro: Cheiridopsis crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically in late summer. Cheiridopsis crassa is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
